title: feat(rust): upgrade heapless to v0.7.1 in signature_core

Upgrades Rust to 1.51 and adds some additional deps needed for `cargo audit`

Thanks @psinghal20 for finding the breakage!

title: feat(rust): move and refactor entity
body:
- Move `Entity` to ockam_entity (had been in ockam due to old dependencies)
- Entity `drop` now calls `stop` on the Entity Context.
- Removed `ProfileUpdate` trait - unclear API and need.
- De-generalized ProfileSet to use `ProfileSync` directly instead of `ProfileTrait`
- Merged `ProfileSet` into Entity.
- Reverted Example 5 to original copy, pre-Entity.
- Introduced Example 5a with Entities and mutual authentication.

title: feat(rust): entity refactor
body:
- Roll back cloud_node_tcp_address copy
- Lower ctx viz in LocalEntity 
- Remove send and receive from LocalEntity
- Remove local entity secure_channel_address
- Remove forwarding from LocalEntity
- Remove RemoteEntity. Its only current use was a small forwarding example. Not fully baked, I don't think.
- LocalEntity randomize address for new context.
- Entity no longer starts a worker.
- `LocalEntity`  renamed to `Entity`.
- Example variables named `local` have been renamed to `alice` and `bob` as appropriate.
- Example secure channel name changed to `bob_secure_channel_listener`

title: feat(rust): add trust policy
Entity Feature
body:
# Entity Feature Branch - Coordination PR

- Updates Examples 5, 6, 9, 12 to use Entities.
- Improves/experiments with Route building by use of `vec!`
- Secure Channel creation is now done through Entity
- Entity can list its active secure channels

title: Initial Entity implementation
body:
This creates a delegating Entity. 

- Entity has a default Profile, and delegates all operations to it
- The Entity type implements `ProfileTrait` 
- ProfileTrait updated to add accessor for a Vault, as well as Clone, Send and static lifetime
- SecureChannel creation refactored to use generic Profile traits instead of `ProfileImpl`. This could move into `Entity` eventually but for now i broke it out into a `SecureChannel` builder. Having Profiles construct the Channels themselves was problematic to the design.

title: Remove old/first website guide source
body: As @SanjoDeundiak pointed out to me, this takes a lot of effort to maintain for the developers changing APIs, and the code is deprecated. I'm going to be replacing the website guide with the newer Get Started guide as soon as I have cycles. The code being removed is just reference code for the website markdown.

title: Add the standard crate lib header to ockam crate
body: One of the serde dependencies precludes a crate-wide `missing_docs` attribute. That attribute was added on all sub-modules though.

title: feat(elixir): Bidirectional messaging using stream API with workers
body:
## Bi directional streams using workers

This proposal describes use of Ockaam streams to set up bi-directional communication
between Ockam NODES.

With this approach a single node can use multiple streams, but multiple nodes SHOULD NOT
use the same stream

### Goals

1. Application workers can exchange messages
1. Application worker ONLY use Ockam Routing protocol
1. Messages can be persisted and re-delivered after network outages

## Background

In order to establish bidirectional communication between ockam workers,
ockam routing protocol is using route tracing.

Each communication hop should produce a return route, which should be usable to
route the message back.

To use unidirectional channels (like streams) to deliver messages, a message on
the channel should contain an other channel ID to produce a response.

Since the return stream information is in the messages, there may be different
return streams in those.

## Routing

This proposal describes routing to NODES, meaning that messages will be routed
on receiving nodes using the Ockam Routing protocol.

This is done to simplify route tracing.

Stream APIs in this proposal are accessed using LOCAL worker addresses.

Example sending a message through stream:

```
onward_route: ["bds_publisher_local_address_on_remote", "remote_destination"]
return_route: ["sender"]
```

Assuming publishers and consumers are properly set up, the response might be:

```
onward_route: ["bds_publisher_local_address_on_sender", "sender"]
return_route: ["remote_destination"]
```

## Stream Client API

Stream client consists of Consumer workers and Publisher workers, which can be set
up to receive/send message to a stream.

Consumer constantly fetches messages using the stream API.
Publishers send messages using the stream API on demand.

Assumption is that we can attach additional logic to consumer and publisher either
via additional workers or functions.

## Bidirectional stream client API

Bidirectional stream client is implemented on top of Stream Client and implements
additional message processing for Consumers and Publishers

### BiDirectional Publisher

Publisher is a worker, which has a local address. Application workers use publisher
address to send messages through streams.

Publisher state contains a stream to send messages to and a return stream to add to
message metadata

When handling an ockam message, the publisher encodes the message as binary together
with return stream and sends it as a stream protocol payload

### BiDirectional consumer

Bidirectional consumer implements a message handling logic to Stream Consumer

1. Decode stream payload
1. Ensure return stream publisher exists
1. Add return stream publisher to return route of the message
1. Route message to the onward route on the local node

To create return stream publisher, consumer needs to have some sort of registry,
to map return stream to local publisher name

### Setting up communication

SERVER:
1. Create consumer for stream "SERVER_STREAM"

CLIENT:
1. Create consumer for stream "CLIENT_STREAM"
1. Create publisher for stream "SERVER_STREAM" and return stream "CLIENT_STREAM"
1. Send messages to through publisher address in the route


### Message exchange:


```
SERVER                       consumer:SERVER   stream_service
 | create (subscribe)              |                 |
 |-------------------------------> |                 |
 |                                 | create_stream   |
 |                                 | --------------->|
 |                                 | <---------------|
 |                                 |                 |
 |                                 | fetch           |
 |                                 |---------------->|
 |                                 |<----------------|
 |                                 |                 |                publisher:CLIENT   consumer:CLIENT            CLIENT
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |  create              |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |<---------------------|
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       |        create                          |
 |                                 |                 |                       | <------------------------------------- |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                                        |
 |                                 |                 |                       |        send                            |
 |                                 |                 |                       | <------------------------------------- |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                                        |
 |                                 |                 | push:SERVER(encoded)  |                 |                      |
 |                                 |                 | <-------------------- |                 |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 | fetch           |                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 |---------------->|                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 |<----------------|                       |                 |                      |
 |         publisher:SERVER        |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |               |    ensure       |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |               |<--------------- |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |               |   address       |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |               |---------------> |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 | forward (rr:+address)           |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |<--------------------------------|                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       |                 |                      |
 |               |                                   |                       |                 |                      |
 |  send (reply) |                                   |                       |                 |                      |
 |-------------->| push:CLIENT(encoded)              |                       |                 |                      |
 |               |---------------------------------->|                                         |                      |
 |                                                   |                  fetch                  |                      |
 |                                 |                 |<----------------------------------------|                      |
 |                                 |                 |---------------------------------------->|                      |
 |                                 |                 |                                         |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       |  ensure         |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       | <-------------- |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       | address         |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                       | --------------> |                      |
 |                                 |                 |                                         | forward(rr:+address) |
 |                                 |                 |                                         | -------------------->|
 |                                 |                 |                                         |                      |

```

title: Release Automation
body:
# Release Automation

First pass at automation of current crate release workflow. This script uses a 'release plan' that simply consists of a file with crate names and bump level (minor or patch).

For example:
```
ockam_core minor
ockam_node patch
ockam_vault minor
ockam minor
```

When this plan is given to `release.sh`, the following occurs:

- Changes since the last released are gathered from git into a `Changelog-INCOMING.md` for each updated crate. This file has the correct version and date populated, as well as section headers. All that a maintainer needs to do is place the git log message content into one of the categories, then cut and paste into the real `Changelog.md`

- The version of the crate is incremented using `cargo bump`.
- The `README.md` of the crate is updated to the correct version.
- For all other Ockam crates, dependencies on the releasing crate are updated.
- Lockfiles are regenerated for all changed crates.
- All crates are checked via `cargo check`  and  will fail on problems
- Runs a final `gradle test_rust`.

title: Spacekookie/tcp api
body:
This commit makes it possible to start multiple TcpRouters with their respective connection workers.

There is a problem with this approach however, because Ockam Node internally associates a whole _address type_ with a router. This means that per node there _can't_ be more than one router per address type.

title: Getting tcp_transport working with multi-hop routes
body:
To run the example:

1. cargo run --example 08-routing-over-transport-many-hops-responder
2. cargo run --example 08-routing-over-transport-many-hops-middle
3. cargo run --example 08-routing-over-transport-many-hops-initiator

To run this in a single binary the TcpTransport API needs to change slightly.

title: build: bump curve25519-dalek from 3.0.2 to 3.1.0 in /implementations/rust/ockam/ockam_vault
body:
Bumps [curve25519-dalek](https://github.com/dalek-cryptography/curve25519-dalek) from 3.0.2 to 3.1.0.
Changelog

Sourced from curve25519-dalek's changelog.

3.1.0

  • Add support for the Elligator2 encoding for Edwards points.
  • Add two optional formally-verified field arithmetic backends which use the Fiat Crypto project's Rust code, which is generated from proofs of functional correctness checked by the Coq theorem proving system.
  • Add support for additional sizes of precomputed tables for basepoint scalar multiplication.
  • Fix an unused import.
  • Add support for using the zeroize traits with all point types. Note that points are not automatically zeroized on Drop, but that consumers of curve25519-dalek should call these methods manually when needed.
Commits
  • 2ea17d5 Update CHANGELOG and README; bump to 3.1.0.
  • 5eca140 Merge pull request #351 from isislovecruft/fix/cleanup-elligator
  • cecc821 Merge pull request #342 from huitseeker/fiat4_with_u32
  • 35d4eab Merge pull request #349 from huitseeker/modernize_benchmarks
  • b05feec Merge pull request #350 from isislovecruft/develop
  • 0da8f08 Maintain legacy 3.x support for lookup tables.
  • ee90202 Trivial cleanups to Elligator2 encoding.
  • d130b5f [benchmarks-only] Updates the benchmarks
  • cc0c444 Merge branch 'feature/dynamic-table-sizes' into develop
  • 1491f0d Update copyright years.
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
